Case reference: 2020010648.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1992, at approximately 9:00pm, Harry White was seen for the last time as he left his father’s residence in Toronto, Ontario. Harry’s boat was later found in Bluffer’s Park with the engine still running.

Case reference: 2019048180.CaseDesc: On August, 11, 2019, Miranda Belle was seen for the last time by her ex-spouse at a family gathering in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Miranda was last heard from via Facebook, on August 17, 2019.

Case reference: 2014002270.CaseDesc: On 2 July, 1992, Behnam Amjadi was seen for the last time when he left his residence in the Côtes-des-Neiges et Notre-Dame-de-Grace district in Montreal, Quebec. Behnam has not been seen and has not contacted his ex-spouse or his brothers in Iran since.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2023025811.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1996 Andrea Robinson was last seen in Niagara Falls, Ontario near Dufferin Island Park. At the time of her disappearance, Andrea was despondent.

Mark: Left Leg, Birth mark 0 lower leg

Case reference: 2006005099.CaseDesc: Gary Millerson was last seen at his residence in Port McNicoll on the 19 April 1991.

Case reference: 2006013999.CaseDesc: Walter Glynn was last seen July 23, 1980 walking southbound on Main Street, Kirkland Lake.  Mr. Glynn was heading to the A&P grocery store at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2020011788.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1982, Ian Shim was seen for the last time when he checked into the Gran Hotel in Pereira, Columbia. Ian, a resident of Toronto, Ontario, was on vacation in Colombia. Shortly after checking in, Ian had gone for a hike, but never returned to his room to collect his personal belongings.

Case reference: 2014003678.CaseDesc: Donald McKillop’s spouse reported him missing on June 21, 1960. When she returned home on June 20 after working away from the house, she discovered he had left. When she last spoke to him on June 19, Donald had made no mention of intending to leave their house for any reason.  He didn't take his wallet or any other personal items when he left. Donald walks with a limp and there is no indication that foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2024040019.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2024, hunters found the body of this female in the woods at the end of a culvert in Coaticook, Quebec, close to border of Vermont and New Hampshire, United States of America. The victim was wearing several pieces of clothing including a toque, winter coat, jeans, wool stockings, winter boots. An autopsy was performed and the probable cause of death is likely due to environmental hypothermia.

Sweater: Blue, White, Long sleeve, "Old Navy" brand

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2013000042.CaseDesc: On August 8, 1999, Mary Smith was seen for the last time as she checked herself out of the Selkirk Mental Health Centre in Selkirk, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Mary had received medical treatment, for head injuries, at the Health Sciences Center in Winnipeg. It is out of character for Mary, a mother of four, to not contact her family.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Flower- orchid or poinsettia

Case reference: 2017065923.CaseDesc: Oleg Chmelev was last seen at his home in the area of Morning Star Drive and Brandon Gate Drive, Mississauga, on October 30, 2017. His green bicycle was also missing and was his main mode of transportation.

Case reference: 2019041509.CaseDesc: On July 17, 2019, at approximately 10:00 am, Kevin Li was seen for the last time leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006013899.CaseDesc: Robert Heintz went missing from Kearns, Ontario on the morning of December 1, 1982.  Mr. Heintz went into the bush behind Larder Lake Public School with some friends and became separated from them.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020019009.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2020, Sameer Patel was seen for the last time by his friends when he accidentally fell into the Niagara River located in Ontario, while hiking.

Case reference: 2014001721.CaseDesc: On April 7, 2003, Luis Betancourt was seen for the last time when he left his home in St. Catharines, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Luis was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012003499.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Tim Maletic left his family residence in Kitchener, Ontario. He left a note saying he was going to Toronto and has not been heard from since. Mr. Maletic also has ties to the Windsor, Ontario area.

Backpack: Blue, Red, Adidas, Blue with red trim

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2022002122.CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004535.CaseDesc: Jack Fraser was last seen on August 2, 2004 at his place of work in downtown Vancouver. His parents reported him missing as they had not seen or heard from him in over two weeks. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2016069646.CaseDesc: James Kunuk was reported missing by his landlord in December, 2016.  He was last seen by his family on September 21st, 2016 in Whitehorse, Yukon.  Mr. Kunuk has previously lived in downtown Vancouver, and also has family connections to the Northwest Territories.  He did not contact his family for his birthday, or over the Christmas holidays, which is unusual for him.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross with "Life" written on it

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2014006374.CaseDesc: Rosalie Jean ALLAN was last seen at the end of November, start of December 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2018045820.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1994, at approximately 1:30 pm, Subarangit Rajanehru was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006235.CaseDesc: A lake freighter capsized in a violent storm on Lake Winnipeg, just north of Hecla Island, Manitoba. The vessel carried nine crew members and one passenger. There was only one survivor who managed to float on a piece of the wreckage to safety. All of the bodies of the remaining occupants were recovered with the exception of Allan Clemens and Tache Everett who were never located. Autopsies confirmed that the causes of death for those recovered were either drowning or death due to exposure in the cold water. Allan and Tache are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2018040315.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Joshua Hill was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000102.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1981 at approximately 7:30 p.m., Lawrence (Larry) Bennett left Princess Harbour, Manitoba in his boat heading for Matheson Island. He left with his sheepdog, and the trip should have taken 20-25 minutes. When he left he was traveling straight into the wind, and the water was reported as being rough. Lawrence (Larry) never arrived at Matheson Island. Lawrence (Larry) is presumed to have drowned, his remains have never been recovered.

Coveralls: Grey, Grey coveralls with black stripe

Case reference: 2014004464.CaseDesc: Singh Sukmwinder Lebahna was last seen in Montreal on February 26, 2004. He left the apartment he was sharing with a friend, taking all his personal belongings, stating he wanted to live in Vancouver. Singh is originally from India.

Case reference: 2013000140.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1981, Rene Laflamme was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. René had visited his mother in Ottawa, Ontario and had left her residence to travel back to Montreal.

Hair: Black, Straight, recently permed black hair

Case reference: 2014006349.CaseDesc: Jonathan Riley left his residence on April 26, 2013, indicating he was going to Toronto for a few days. His mode of transportation is unknown as he did not have access to a vehicle.  His family and friends have not heard from him since May 2013.  He is a self-employed computer technician.

Scar: Torso (Front), Possibly has surgical scar on one shoulder

Case reference: 2014004798.CaseDesc: On the 25th of October, 1954, Tersilla Bonthoux, 79 years old, was last seen walking from Duck Lake towards the farm homestead where she used to reside, approximately 13 km away. Tersilla was reported missing and extensive searches of the area failed to locate any trace of her.

Case reference: 2023049573.CaseDesc: Olivier St-Denis was last seen while out for a walk on September 10, 2023, in the town of Malartic, in the Regional Municipality of La Vallée-de-l'Or, in Quebec. Olivier has not been seen and we have not heard from him since that time.

Sweater: Cotton, Green, khaki checkered pattern vest

Case reference: 2012020098.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1975, at approximately 3:00 a.m., Irene Scherban was seen for the last time in front of her residence in Hudson Bay, Saskatchewan. Prior to her disappearance, Irene had attended a party.

Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, HBCH High school insignia ring
Mark: Chest, Round birthmark located near ribcage area
Nose, Thin red mark below the bridge of nose

Case reference: 2014002866.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1989, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Jason Boulton slipped and fell into the water near 12 Mile Creek at the north east corner of the Generating Station in Port Dalhousie Harbour, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002914.CaseDesc: Edward Allan Street was last seen at his rooming house on Columbia St in Kamloops, BC.  At around 8:30 am on March 4, 2000, Edward told his friends that he was quickly dropping by his place of work but would be back in time for a meeting at 10:00 am.  His wallet and ID were left inside his room.

Amputation: Right Ring Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Right Middle Finger, Amputated at 1st knuckle
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Foot, Broken foot as a child

Case reference: 2024034158.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Dinwoodie was last seen in the early morning hours of July 4, 2024, in the area of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005149.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2008, Zelalem Assefa was last seen visiting relatives in Calgary, Alberta. Zelalem is from Ethiopia and had only been in Canada for about a year and a half when he disappeared.

Case reference: 2014004010.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1993, Howard Metacat was last seen in Indian Cabins, Alberta. Howard was hunting alone along the Hay River, 6 miles north of Indian Cabins and wandered away from his campsite in the early morning hours of September 17, 1993.

Scar: Neck, 2 inches on the right side

Case reference: 2014005286.CaseDesc: Karl Behr was last seen on December 25, 1981, in Edmonton, Alberta, when he left a family function to return to his residence. It was noted that Karl's green parka and winter boots were missing from his home. Karl speaks with a slight German accent.

Case reference: 2022048901.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2021, at approximately 7:33 a.m., Madison Roy-Boudreau was seen for the last time when she was picked up in a vehicle driven by a man at the corner of Assaff and Grange Streets in Bathurst, New Brunswick. Madison has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006011799.CaseDesc: Thomas Lyon was last seen in the area of Iron Bridge, Pelican Lake, Sioux Lookout on June 28, 1998 by two acquaintances.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000079.CaseDesc: Gilles Chiasson has been missing from Montreal since April 18, 1995. Mr. Chiasson took a taxi after a night out in a bar and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2015059337.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Van Huong was last seen on vacation in Vietnam. The next morning, Van’s family noticed he had left the hotel room and had not returned.

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible he was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Frederick was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2012020048.CaseDesc: Kathleen Johnston went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 2:15 p.m. on October 20, 1953. Miss Johnston got off of a city transit bus on her way to work at the Gem Café in the downtown area after visiting her mother at her residence.

Case reference: 2013000099.CaseDesc: William Andersen and a co-worker were designated to conduct a wildlife survey in northern Manitoba. The men had flown into North Indian Lake on June 26th and departed by canoe from there. On the second day when the men attempted to shoot some rapids, their canoe hit a rock which overturned, throwing both men into the river. Mr. Andersen was not seen again. Air and land searches failed to locate Mr. Andersen and he is presumed dead as a result of drowning. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Scar: 1" long scar 3/8" wide on the back of either the left or right hand.

Case reference: 2018046253.CaseDesc: On January 31, 1997, at approximately 4:30pm, Daphne Powell was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Daphne left her residence with two suitcases, some money and indicated that she was going to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2014001691.CaseDesc: Norman Krolman was last seen withdrawing money from an ATM machine.  He was a self-employed computer programmer and was in business with a partner.  He had a steady girlfriend and a small circle of friends.

Case reference: 2014005762.CaseDesc: On April 25, 2011, Yuji Fujita was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Yuji had called in sick to work on April 26 and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020007642.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1971, Ethel Crespo was last seen by her husband in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Ethel was two months pregnant.

Case reference: 2012020101.CaseDesc: William Gill was last seen in the early morning hours of December 21, 1981, leaving an apartment on Appleby Drive in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. William had been out earlier that evening with a co-worker. It is very unusual for William to be out of contact with his family, particularly before Christmas.

Case reference: 2021006608.CaseDesc: On July 4,2020, Anna Marquart was last seen by her husband and her sister as she walked away from her residence in Glenboro, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along the bank of the Ottawa river in Gatineau, Quebec.

Case reference: 2008003299.CaseDesc: On May 17, 1985, Cyril Cheong was fishing on White Lake with his friends when the weather deteriorated and strong winds started to blow. Mr. Cheong's boat capsized and his friends were unable to save him.  One of his friends saw him, approximately 2 to 3 feet under the water, beyond his reach.

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003138.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1981, John Sanderson was with some friends in Berens River, Manitoba.  He left in a 22' boat heading for Jackhead, Manitoba.  Friends tried to stop him from leaving due to the high winds but he left anyway. On October 19, 1981, the boat that he had taken was found upside down and partly submerged near the shore of Pigeon Point. Gas cans that had been in the boat were also located.  Searches were done by air and water but the body of John was never found. It is presumed that Mr. Sanderson drowned.

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2018043199.CaseDesc: In December of 1995, Myung Lim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Myung and his wife had an argument and he told her he was returning to South Korea.

Case reference: 2021023948.CaseDesc: On May 6, 2021, David Anthony Gale was seen for the last time at the Independent Grocer in Athabasca, Alberta. David has not been seen or heard from since and police are seeking the public's assistance for any information regarding his disappearance.

Case reference: 2010000499.CaseDesc: David Kruger was running a business with another individual, and was experiencing financial difficulties. On April 26, 1979, Mr. Kruger was last seen by his business partner, who reported him missing on May 2, 1979. He has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Kruger's mother had died approximately 3 weeks prior, so it is possible he may have been depressed. He was last seen at his residence in Guelph, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018041446.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1998, Richard Opato was last known to be in the region of Niagara Falls, Ontario at approximately 5:30 p.m. There has been no news of his whereabouts or well being since this time.

Hair: Brown, Short, Other, Losing hair on the top of his head

Case reference: 2012020125.CaseDesc: Serge Crevier was last seen on July 17, 2006, around 1:30 pm at his residence in Gatineau. The car that he was using, a grey Oldsmobile Alero 2002, was found on September 10, 2006 in Thorne, in the Outaouais region.

Case reference: 2022065086.CaseDesc: Marcos Sosa Mercado was last seen on November 18, 2022 in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At that time Marcos was feeling despondent.

Case reference: 2013000115.CaseDesc: Gaby Luonga Kombe was last seen on August 23, 1999, in Montreal, Quebec. He had to go to Pie-IX metro station to meet a friend. Later in the evening, he called his son to tell him he was heading home. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2020015197.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Tony Noskey was seen for the last time as he was riding a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle with his friends near the community of Cadotte Lake in Alberta. During the course of this outing, Tony had disappeared into the bush, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001684.CaseDesc: On June 30th, 1974 Brent Forsyth was 11 years of age when he went missing while fishing along the Bulkley River by Two Mile Creek in Hazelton BC. Brent was last seen upriver fishing a back-eddy. As a result of Brent's disappearance an extensive search involving community members, search and rescue, RCMP Police Dog Services and RCMP air service entailed. Despite these efforts and continued investigations he has never been located. Police have received new information about Brent and are seeking anyone who might have additional information about Brent's disappearance to come forward.

Deformity: Nick on the top right ear

Case reference: 2012020052.CaseDesc: Marilyn Byskal went missing on June 20, 1974, while on a school organized canoe trip. She was last seen at her tent when everyone first woke up in the morning. Most present at the camp felt that Miss Byskal fell into the fast flowing waters of the Grass River, however no one witnessed this. An extensive 10 day water and ground search was conducted with negative results.

Case reference: 2014005026.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2007, Eric Cox was seen for the last time when he boarded the Marine Atlantic Ferry in North Sydney, Nova Scotia heading to Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2014002445.CaseDesc: On April 9, 1998, Elaine Dumba was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Ms. Dumba’s family have not seen or heard from her since April 9, 1989.

Case reference: 2014000022.CaseDesc: Cynthia Albena Audy was last seen getting into a vehicle in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba on October 28th, 2004.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart and cross

Case reference: 2014004389.CaseDesc: On October 23, 2003, Bertha Melvin, who was residing in a group home, left a note advising she was going to the hospital; however she failed to show up.  Ms. Melvin is described a being very introverted and may have been frequenting the rural areas of Waterways in Fort McMurray, AB.

Case reference: 2014005893.CaseDesc: On September 23, 2012, Timothy Colbon was seen for the last time as he left a residence, without wearing any shoes, in Elk Lake, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Timothy had travelled with friends from London, Ontario to Elk Lake.

Case reference: 2016013490.CaseDesc: On March 15, 2016, Ravishankar Vallepuram was seen for the last time at his residence in Scarborough, Ontario. Ravishankar has never gone missing in the past, nor has he spent the night away from his residence.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2014005571.CaseDesc: On March 18, 2011, Isabelle Roy-Roland left the Levis Hospital after receiving a permission to leave the grounds. She was never seen again.

Coat: Brown, 3/4 length coat with fur on the hood

Case reference: 2014003890.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1973, Guy Carignan was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia with a female friend. His family reported him missing on May 28, 1980. Investigations were conducted in Edmonton, Alberta and Vancouver, British Columbia. Law enforcement were unable to locate Guy or his female friend.

Case reference: 2019017116.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2003, Anne-Marie Laforest was last seen by her family in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006024399.CaseDesc: Mark Cornett was last seen at Missinaibi Lake, 1.0 kilometre north of Fairy Point in Missinaibi Township. He was involved in a boating accident on his way back from fishing and is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014005541.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2010, Shawn Smith was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. On September 6, Shawn arrived in the Dominican Republic and was scheduled to return on the September 12, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2016068490.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1971, Mr. Georges Turcotte went missing from the Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec area. Georges was last seen at his home with his wife.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Snake or zig zag

Case reference: 2006015899.CaseDesc: Pamela Holopainen was last seen in the city of Timmins, Ontario in the early morning hours of December 14, 2003, following a house party.

Case reference: 2014006111.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2013, Holly Balzer was reported missing from Calgary, Alberta. Two months prior to her disappearance, Holly last spoke to members of her family.

Deformity: Mouth, has no teeth - sometimes wears dentures
Foreign Object: Left Ankle, pins from a leg break

Case reference: 2022012467.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1988, Paul Moore was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Lewiston, New York. His vehicle was subsequently found abandoned in a parking lot near the American Falls. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004920.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004 William "Bruce" Molaski left his residence in Toronto, Ontario, in a maroon pick-up truck. A few days later, police found Mr. Molaski's truck at 16 Regatta Road in Toronto.
